text.section:
The provisions of subsection (c)(1) and (3) of this section do not apply to the transfer of a vehicle if:
A vehicle that is transferred was previously exempt under subsection (a)(17) or (18) of this section; and
The transferee of the vehicle titles and registers the vehicle under any other section of this title.

The Administration may exempt from the excise tax imposed by this part any vehicle of a law enforcement agency of the United States or of any other state, if the United States or other state provides a reciprocal exemption for law enforcement vehicles of this State.

If the owner of a vehicle that is exempt under subsection (a)(17) or (18) of this section from the vehicle excise tax subsequently registers the vehicle under any other section of this title, the owner shall pay the excise tax based on the fair market value of the vehicle at the time the exemption was initially granted.
